author: Zsoldier
body:
Tested on both CENTOS 7 and Ubuntu 16.04
Adding repo as instructed in both systems.
Running install w/ option of "powershell" or "powershell-preview" results in an installation of the current powershell "preview" version.  

"Powershell" option never targets current stable release version.

Workaround is to simply download pkg or directly reference git uri to appropriate pkg.

comments.author: iSazonov
comments.body:
Seems this will not work until 6.1 release.
/cc @TravisEz13

comments.author: TravisEz13
comments.body: @Zsoldier we could delete the preview packages that were published as `powershell` but at this point, I think it is better for us to just wait until 6.1 is released and that will fix it.  cc/ @SteveL-MSFT  @daxian-dbw

comments.author: SteveL-MSFT
comments.body: Yes, we are in a transition state unfortunately.  With 6.1 release next month, I think this will be cleaned up.

comments.author: TravisEz13
comments.body: Closing this issue as I think this has been answered and the fix has already been made.  We are just waiting for the 6.1 release to happen.

title: Powershell installation via package manager method results in 'preview' version regardless of option chosen.
